Definition.WordDefinition: send off v 1: send away towards a designated goal [syn: {dispatch}, {despatch}] 2: throw, send, or cast forward; "project a missile" [syn: {project}] 3: transfer; "The spy sent the classified information off to Russia" [syn: {send}, {get off}]

send-off n 1: an organized expression of goodwill at the start of a trip or new venture [syn: {bon voyage}] 2: a start given to contestants; "I was there with my parents at the kickoff" [syn: {kickoff}, {start-off}]
